TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content: Beale,you will add an IVA about the "TK-CC08C "Spectre" Crew Capsule" ?

Very cool Gemini stuff!

Many thanks!

I'll be sure to send one to Sarnus soon!

The Soyuz rocket does not look really real-ish to me, but other than that, it's great.

If you check the poll up top, I'm currently looking into "real-ifying" the thing a bit.

Omg that IVA looks so cool!

I just did a career mun landing with the Tantares parts... and boy it was fun!!!

I landed perfectly with the LK on the first try and when i later rendezvoued with the Munar Soyuz, i had fuel to spare....

No picture because i was so excited in doing it right, i have broadcasted it on Steam... but too bad that it won't save it online...

Thanks!

I would certainly like to see pictures of that, my LK attempts are often a bit botched.

Nice work...

I joined just to say how much I love this mod. I do admit I use the HGR version of Soyuz, but every thing here is dynomite. I am also loving the big G module. What about making the bottom concave with an extra node to fit a docking port? Or just making the big G a 1.25 docking port? It would avoid the "control from here" issue with making the back of the Gemini a docking port.

Another first post!

Thank you it means a lot to hear.

The bottom: like it is currently to maintain the heatshield.

The real Big-G had its huge service module, followed by a little docking "nub" at the end.

Is this what you are meaning?

It would be kinda cool!

http://imgur.com/a/hVUtA

Not quite done with it yet(bit more testing, and balance tweaking to do) my first manned pod ever so I'm not trusting that some terrible bug, or design flaw won't rear its head when I let my guard down.

That came out of no where!

Very very cool! I would like to fly this.

You have even made the Window lights functional, very cool!

The real Big-G had its huge service module, followed by a little docking "nub" at the end.

There were multiple designs for the Big G. FASA already did the one you mentioned above. The one below hasn't really been explored like that:

There were multiple designs for the Big G. FASA already did the one you mentioned above. The one below hasn't really been explored like that:

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/07/Big_Gemini.png

This is what I had in mind when I suggested having the big G module act like a docking port.

Although a massive service module has got me thinking of other applications. From what I have seen, even this massive service module had crew/cargo space.

Edit: I was thinking of one of those passages through the heat shield. I know someone posted a picture. So maybe not a real docking port.

Did a little mission using Tantares parts. It's a little space lab. It's image intensive so here's the link.

Will we see the Zenit spysat anytime soon? Maybe after the Soyuz revamp?

Likely, the Vostok CM obviously needs a little bit of love. It's currently one of the few holdover parts along with the LK.

So a Zenit is something that can be bundled together along with that.

There were multiple designs for the Big G. FASA already did the one you mentioned above. The one below hasn't really been explored like that:

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/07/Big_Gemini.png

This is what I had in mind when I suggested having the big G module act like a docking port.

Although a massive service module has got me thinking of other applications. From what I have seen, even this massive service module had crew/cargo space.

Edit: I was thinking of one of those passages through the heat shield. I know someone posted a picture. So maybe not a real docking port.

Mmm, that design is nicer! And a little more feasible for KSP.

I understand the concept now.

Doing this whole craft = new texture sheet (Room for custom texture for Big G and Cylinder SM).

So maybe will be a nice small project some time.
